author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author: Epictetus
quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Seneca
quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Epictetus
quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Seneca
quote: He who is brave is free.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

author: Epictetus
quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Epictetus
quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

author: Seneca
quote: No man was ever wise by chance.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

author: Epictetus
quote: Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.

author: Seneca
quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

author: Seneca
quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love...

author: Epictetus
quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

author: Seneca
quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.

author: Epictetus
quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

author: Epictetus
quote: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.

author: Seneca
quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

author: Epictetus
quote: Don't just say you are a Stoic. Be a Stoic.

author: Seneca
quote: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.

author: Epictetus
quote: It is not things themselves that disturb us, but our opinions about them.

author: Seneca
quote: A man who suffers before it is necessary, suffers more than is necessary.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: What we do now echoes in eternity.

author: Epictetus
quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it. Skillful pilots gain their reputation from storms and tempests.

author: Seneca
quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.

author: Epictetus
quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.

author: Seneca
quote: Life is long if you know how to use it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.

author: Epictetus
quote: If you wish to be rich, do not add to your money, but subtract from your desire.

author: Seneca
quote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more in imagination than in reality.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.

author: Epictetus
quote: What is the essence of life? To serve others and do good.

author: Seneca
quote: A man who has committed a mistake and doesn't correct it, is committing another mistake.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: You are a little soul carrying around a corpse.

author: Epictetus
quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.

author: Seneca
quote: It is not the external events that disturb us, but our judgment about them.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks, but only to what he does himself, to make it just and holy.

author: Epictetus
quote: Freedom is the power to live as one wishes.

author: Seneca
quote: A fool is one who has not learned to control his own mind.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Choose not to be harmed—and you won't feel harmed. Don't feel harmed—and you haven't been.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: Well-being is realized by small steps, but it is no small thing.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.

author: Zeno of Citium
quote: No evil is honorable, but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
